date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2025

top_reviews.title: 🌟THIS KEYBOARD IS FANTASTIC🌟 10/10 - Great Gift for WFH !
top_reviews.body: The media could not be loaded. This review is for the Green Wireless Keyboard and Mouse, KOOTOP Cute Green Colorful Keyboard and Mouse, 2.4G Wireless Keyboard with Retro Round Keycap for PC, Mac, Laptop,Tablet,Computer Windows (Green) ……….…… ……….…… ……….……  To summarize this item in one word - FANTASTIC!  The Look - The design is very welcoming & user friendly. In comparison to a common work keyboard (LOGI K360) it is a similar layout. The KOOTOP keyboard is about 2-inches longer that a common work keyboard & is about 1/2-inch thicker. The base of the keyboard has a smooth, glossy finish which is very easy to clean. The keys are a smooth matte finish & the key labels are stickers on the keys. The key shape is a nontraditional, typewriter kind of shape. If you don’t have long nails, these keys are nicely designed to fit your finger without being too close to each other. Certain keys do not have written indicators (tab, shift, delete, enter) however it is clearly translated what those keys are meant for. The mouse has a matte finish on the bottom & a smooth glossy finish on top. There are 4 buttons on the mouse: left click, right click, the scrolling wheel, & a side trigger (preferable for PC gaming). It is about the same size as a common work mouse & fits very comfortable in your hand.  The Function - The KOOTOP keyboard works as well as a standard keyboard. The keys all have immediate responses & are very easy to press on. Despite the gaps between the keys, I do not struggle with hitting the right key/falling into the gaps. I wear acrylic nails, so while I see multiple people speaking to the quietness of the keyboard I unfortunately cannot relate. For us gel tipped superstars, the key tapping can be a little louder than those with shorter nails but it’s not that abrasive, high pitched, scratching sound you get from hitting a key on a Mac/LOGI keyboard. I’ve included a video for reference. The mouse is a low, pleasant click & is also very responsive in click & scroll. The mouse won’t work unless you click to wake it. Both operate on one double-A (AA) battery each & batteries are provided.  The Feel - This might sound a little extra, but this keyboard genuinely makes me want to sit down & type. The color wave & the sound make this keyboard a very inviting tool - especially for work. The color options give a choice for every aesthetic & vibe (that being said, GIVE MORE COLOR OPTIONS!). I can’t think of anyone who wouldn’t benefit from the experience of this keyboard.  Tldr; Buy it, love it, thank me later ✨ Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
The media could not be loaded.
This review is for the Green Wireless Keyboard and Mouse, KOOTOP Cute Green Colorful Keyboard and Mouse, 2.4G Wireless Keyboard with Retro Round Keycap for PC, Mac, Laptop,Tablet,Computer Windows (Green)
……….…… ……….…… ……….……

To summarize this item in one word - FANTASTIC!

The Look - The design is very welcoming & user friendly. In comparison to a common work keyboard (LOGI K360) it is a similar layout. The KOOTOP keyboard is about 2-inches longer that a common work keyboard & is about 1/2-inch thicker. The base of the keyboard has a smooth, glossy finish which is very easy to clean. The keys are a smooth matte finish & the key labels are stickers on the keys. The key shape is a nontraditional, typewriter kind of shape. If you don’t have long nails, these keys are nicely designed to fit your finger without being too close to each other. Certain keys do not have written indicators (tab, shift, delete, enter) however it is clearly translated what those keys are meant for. The mouse has a matte finish on the bottom & a smooth glossy finish on top. There are 4 buttons on the mouse: left click, right click, the scrolling wheel, & a side trigger (preferable for PC gaming). It is about the same size as a common work mouse & fits very comfortable in your hand.

The Function - The KOOTOP keyboard works as well as a standard keyboard. The keys all have immediate responses & are very easy to press on. Despite the gaps between the keys, I do not struggle with hitting the right key/falling into the gaps. I wear acrylic nails, so while I see multiple people speaking to the quietness of the keyboard I unfortunately cannot relate. For us gel tipped superstars, the key tapping can be a little louder than those with shorter nails but it’s not that abrasive, high pitched, scratching sound you get from hitting a key on a Mac/LOGI keyboard. I’ve included a video for reference. The mouse is a low, pleasant click & is also very responsive in click & scroll. The mouse won’t work unless you click to wake it. Both operate on one double-A (AA) battery each & batteries are provided.

The Feel - This might sound a little extra, but this keyboard genuinely makes me want to sit down & type. The color wave & the sound make this keyboard a very inviting tool - especially for work. The color options give a choice for every aesthetic & vibe (that being said, GIVE MORE COLOR OPTIONS!). I can’t think of anyone who wouldn’t benefit from the experience of this keyboard.

Tldr; Buy it, love it, thank me later ✨

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2025

top_reviews.title: Really cute
top_reviews.body: Awesome and SUPER cute, but the USB connector thingy that goes into the computer broke, and now the whole thing is useless. I wish I could get that one part without having to replace the whole thing. Other than that though, I suggest you get it! I never had to change the batteries after a good 7 months of use (weirdly enough), and the connection was very good. Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2025

top_reviews.title: Quality not worth the price.
top_reviews.body: The entire combo did not work at all. Mouse did not even bother connecting to my device and keyboard had a mind of it's own where it duplicated what I pressed; at times it didn't even pick up that a certain key was pressed. Two stars given because the sound of the keycap feedback was nice. Read more
